meaningMnemonic: The <kanji>master</kanji> <kanji>wife</kanji> is the one that takes care of all your stuff for you. She is the <vocabulary>housewife</vocabulary>, a very common profession for married ladies in Japan, though things have been changing little by little. Still, being a housewife means you control the money, which is pretty neat if you ask me.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
